title: Sikhism
summary: Sikhism (/ˈsɪkɪzəm/)  or Sikhi (Punjabi: ਸਿੱਖੀ Sikkhī, [ˈsɪkhiː], from ਸਿੱਖ, Sikh, 'disciple', 'seeker', or 'learner')[lower-roman 1] is a religion originated in the Punjab region of the Indian subcontinent[lower-roman 2] around the end of the 15th century CE.[1][2][3][4][5][6]  Sikhism is one of the youngest of the major religions and the world's fifth-largest organized religion,[7] with about 25–30 million Sikhs as of the early 21st century.[8][9]
